documents.document: @nlkingauthor @frippet @ProudMumbles @Meanjin the actor tweeting via this account is unable to get her head around this one.
@nlkingauthor @frippet @ProudMumbles @Meanjin could be the actor playing @juliekoh
@vangeyzel Thank you!
@alicektg @Meanjin Thank you, Alice! I've had a lot of time to write this, being in custody and all.
@damonayoung @RuthQuibell So happy to have had your joint approval! Thanks!
@chloepapas Thanks, Chloe!
@MsFriedmann Thank you!
@writers_bloc Thanks!!
@PatrAllington Thanks, Patrick!
I wrote a piece for @Meanjin on what I'm reading. Features a first look at two incredible February releases. https://t.co/6zmM8sAcDw
@vangeyzel So much Saunders to catch up on.
@alanvaarwerk @PatrickLenton don't worry, there's always the next Star Wars!
@PatrickLenton @alanvaarwerk is that the one with the Asian love interest on the ferris wheel?
@alanvaarwerk @PatrickLenton Yep, I haven't seen Rogue One and have been dying to go. Tell me the end. Maybe in a DM. Will prob see EoS too!
@PatrickLenton @alanvaarwerk Maybe we should delete our spoiler tweets, Patrick!
@PatrickLenton @alanvaarwerk (I was once told the twist in The Sixth Sense and have consequently never seen it.)
@PatrickLenton @alanvaarwerk Sorry, Alan! You can tell me the end of a great new movie I haven't seen. Moonlight? Patrick & I are going soon
@PatrickLenton @alanvaarwerk And you got me talking to a bunch of other writers about defining the 'wave'.
@PatrickLenton It's great that you stuck your neck out & claimed a new wave, @alanvaarwerk. Definitely got me thinking hard about my work.
@damonayoung TOTALLY! The best super cookie imaginable. I love 'Tony T' so much I once wrote about it 4 @LaurieSteed https://t.co/i7RIMPAis5
.@PatrickLenton on art and joy, La La Land and #PortableCuriosities. https://t.co/vAEQyF1Jwj
@jazir1979 haha @inexorablist I love how you say that to people who mention they're reading PC/BAGS16, forcing them to say something nice! x
@vangeyzel Oh! I'll have to pick up Pastoralia. Thanks for the tip!
@vangeyzel Argh, we're trying! It'll be a while yet. But this year, at least!
#PortableCuriosities made @marksmith0257's list of favourite recent debuts. Thanks, Mark! https://t.co/Q17sKW0HxK
@marksmith0257 Thanks, Mark!!
Four signed copies of #PortableCuriosities now available at @ReadingsBooks' @Library_Vic store. Thanks, Readings! https://t.co/MS1x4EXmAT
Next time you're in a bookstore, check out @jeff_the_peff's illustrations in The Barefoot Investor. https://t.co/QE7MqaABg6
@Irma_Gold Thank you, Irma!!
@IrrefutableYou thanks so much, Sass!
@jemappelle_jen Thanks so much, Jennifer!
@andregoiano @BooksActually André! I'm so glad you enjoyed it. Thanks for supporting our anthology :)
@inexorablist @RajithSHS @mwikramanayake definitely a Dyson Hot+Cool with Jet Focus Control & a lot of Admiration for Your Fiction, Rojash.
@RajithSHS @mwikramanayake only one of your greatest fans, Rijay!
@damonayoung @RNBreakfast @UQPbooks Thanks for the kind words, Damon!
.@mwikramanayake asked authors to pick their top reads for 2016. (Btw, 'Rakish' is an in-joke. I do actually know… https://t.co/xRA6wicvdQ
@damonayoung I think you're better at Chinese than I am! It's "slow", which is also my regular speed.
@damonayoung thanks for trying! it rhymes with 'oh'. Though when you write it in Chinese for some reason it's pronounced 'Shu'. Nfi why!
@damonayoung parts of it are based on ghost stories my extended family has told me!
@damonayoung absolutely. That's why I get confused when people say the book is satire: e.g. the first story is very different from the rest.
@damonayoung Oh! Amazing! That's incredible. Thank you!
@ccorbettauthor @damonayoung Well, my entire book IS in cross-stitch.
@haylesnew Thank you so much, Hayley! Happy New Year!
@damonayoung Thank you, Damon!
@AffirmPress Still working on NYE?! Being considered a comedy writer is probably my most unexpected (and crowning) achievement!
Five years of writing in one stack. Going to try having a holiday now. Thanks for all your support and have a great… https://t.co/upgXwXdgu8
@jongresham @BooksActually thanks so much, Jon! Have a great new year :)
#PortableCuriosities in @PatrickLenton's Summer Reading Guide: 'everything u need to keep ur holidays nice & odd.' https://t.co/VgLj0H2vkO
@MarryinB Thanks, Marian! I'm so glad you enjoyed PC!
@EvaLomski Merry Christmas, Eva!
@fauxhemian thanks so much, Ina!
.@mwikramanayake @inexorablist Didn’t get to read much this year but one of the books I adored was Ruins by… https://t.co/BAVE5vIodE
'Cream Reaper' & 'Julia Koh' mentioned in a round-up of this year's 'best ofs'. Thx for the link, @mitch_wright64! https://t.co/TIaCDsoqtz
.@BooksActually's Gold Standard is @BusinessTimes' favourite anthology of 2016. https://t.co/TB7rlSbpBN
Was just in line at Coles behind a guy who looked like @SeanRabinWriter (or at least photos I’d seen). He turned ou… https://t.co/1tPTDsGHD2
@LCarrollHarris @millsjenjen Thanks for the mention, @thebooksdesk! Yes, my fiction is the burn-down-everything sort! ;)
@mwikramanayake @AusWomenWriters yeah sure! I actually am not totally sure of the dates but let's catch up when I'm there :)
#PortableCuriosities is one of @DailyLifeAu's feminist reading picks of the year. Thanks for the mention,… https://t.co/MWOxsesZOq
@Meanjin @millsjenjen ...(love/hate/love) – all about traps and trapdoors. And thank you for the @tom_cho/George Saunders comparisons.
@Meanjin @millsjenjen Jennifer! Thank you so much for writing about PC!! Everything you say is so true. It's a very Sydney book...
@Jake2084 hahaha I am considering that alternative title for future editions ;)
Congrats to the winners and thanks for the support, @mascarareview!
V. pleased that @BooksActually's Gold Standard was shortlisted for Best Anthology in @mascarareview's Best Avant-garde Literary Awards 2016.
So excited that @londonkoreanist has ordered a copy of @BooksActually's Gold Standard! Thanks, Deborah! https://t.co/5xWGGsYyx6
@londonkoreanist @BooksActually @TiltedAxisPress Oh my gosh – thank you so much for ordering a copy! I hope you enjoy it!
@lachbr @UQPbooks I have found the line between fiction & reality is continuing to blur, so this may well be the start of a new short story!
A hundred signed copies of #PortableCuriosities – ordered by one customer! https://t.co/k4fSbXoQ7p
@Roj_Ame oh I'm so glad! Thanks, Roj!
@Roj_Ame Thanks so much for picking up my book, Roj! Very pleased to know you're feeling those feelings about that story ;)
@lady_sings_it hehe I was very much #TeamLadySingsitBetter. So glad to have met you! Thx for putting us in the same room, @RNBooksAndArts!
@redhatwritings Nice shot! Thanks, JZ :)
@inexorablist 'Flora Litvinova has said he was "completely incapable of saying 'No' to anybody."'
... apparently 'he regularly sent cards to himself to test how well the postal service was working'.
So, having had to spell 'Shostakovich' on radio this morning, I've started reading his Wikipedia page...
This morning's spelling bee with @willkostakis, @aliciasometimes & Lisa Gorton on @RNBooksAndArts. FERRANTE! https://t.co/IrPDHbr7SB
@willkostakis didn’t get to say I’m a big fan. Loved Loathing Lola when I read it a while back. Hoping to catch up on ur other books soon!
@marksmith0257 @RNBooksAndArts @mike_sh thanks! That was such a fun show. Poor @willkostakis got all the hard words!
Just finished the @RNBooksAndArts spelling bee and am sticking around to watch more from the amazing Lady Sings it… https://t.co/d26uLid1x8
Tomorrow at ~10am I'll be trying to save face participating in a spelling bee on @RNBooksAndArts – their final live broadcast for the year.
@vangeyzel I just bought a copy using my own credit card. Not sure why it isn't working4u. We can sort out a direct PayPal payment via DM?
@vangeyzel oh man, still working out the kinks. Will get back to you!
@vangeyzel you might be interested?
For anyone in Oz wanting to buy @BooksActually's Gold Standard 2016, I'm now shipping copies locally.… https://t.co/yZRLVbqru1
@inexorablist @Jake2084 Hmm. Do you have any recommendations for other Hunger Games/Divergent-like movies I should be watching?
@inexorablist @Jake2084 ...and my ignorance about what came before and after.
@inexorablist @Jake2084 now I don't have to read Divergent! ;) Actually I quite enjoyed that second Hunger Games movie...
@inexorablist @Jake2084 ah, of course the sister has to die
@hilarysimmons_ together
@hilarysimmons_ have had many a lettuce juice in my life – definitely does not compare to a good loaf of sourdough and a sack of potatoes
@GaborHolch Thanks, Gabor :)
@inexorablist @Jake2084 ah, so it takes the 2nd-best guy to be a dick for a girl to go for the best guy. dies b/c of bad romantic choices?
@hilarysimmons_ so carbs positive, I like this approach.
@inexorablist @Jake2084 it's ok, I don't mind not understanding. Also – didn't quite understand why she didn't go for that peeta guy.
@inexorablist @Jake2084 (I only saw the second Hunger Games – they talked incessantly about berries)
@inexorablist @Jake2084 we're basically all trapped and eating poisoned berries
@Jake2084 @inexorablist though it would prob be an advantage in the market to be compared to Hunger Games ;)
@Jake2084 @inexorablist Hey thanks, Jake! :) Yen-Rong – thx for the loyalty even while asleep!
@hilarysimmons_ will be learning those 'dog in a backpack' lyrics.
@laureningram HEY thanks, @geraldmellor! So flattered :)
@damonayoung Oh – thanks so much, Damon! :)
